About Me

A recent graduate of BC, I developed a love for startups during my time in Australia. There, I worked for Langoor, an awesome new web development company founded by a 24-year-old entrepreneur. Since then, I've been addicted to starting and being a part of as many new ventures as possible. During my senior year at BC, I founded Maji Bottles, a water bottle company aimed at solving the world's water crisis. With the help of a number of mentors in the Boston startup community, our team was able to place 3rd at the 2012 BC Venture Competition and 1st at the 2012 BC Seed Social Venture Competition. Though Maji remains a passionate sideproject, I am hoping to join a Boston startup full-time in order to broaden my skillset, gain valuable insight from others in the startup community, and form a lifelong network of friends who are all passionate about changing the world.
